title.rendered: BC PNP Latest Draw July 11, 2023 ~ 207 Nominations

Share Tweet Share Pin
[vc_column_text]on July 11, 2023, British Columbia (BC) unveiled the latest BC PNP draw results, giving an opportunity to highly skilled and semi-skilled workers. This draw, conducted specifically under the BC PNP Skills Immigration category, aims to attract individuals in occupations that are in high demand within the province.

Notably, candidates from the Express Entry BC stream were also included, reflecting the program’s commitment to diversity and inclusivity.

A total of around 207 lucky individuals received Invitations to Apply (ITAs) under the British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program. These individuals, part of the BC PNP’s candidate pool, consist of both Skilled Workers and International Graduates. The minimum score required for this draw varied ranging from 60 to 109 depending on the specific stream and category within the BC PNP.

  • Draw Date: July 11, 2023
  • No. of Invitations: ~ 207
  • BC PNP Stream: Skills Immigration
  • Minimum Score: Ranging from 60-109

BC PNP Latest Draw Results: July 11, 2023

In the latest BC PNP draw, the province of British Columbia issued a total of approximately 152 Invitations to Apply (ITAs) to eligible candidates. These ITAs were distributed among five different applicant categories, each with its own specific minimum score requirement. Here is the detailed breakdown of the ITAs issued in this draw:

Date Number of
Invitations		 Stream Minimum
Score		 Description
July 11, 2023 152 Skilled Worker 106 General draw
(includes tech occupations)
Skilled Worker – EEBC option 106
International Graduate 109
International Graduate – EEBC option 109
Entry Level and Semi-Skilled 87

BC PNP Targeted Draws

In addition to the general draw, the latest BC PNP round also included targeted draws that resulted in the issuance of nearly 55 Invitations to Apply (ITAs) to eligible candidates. These ITAs were allocated to three specific applicant categories: Childcare, Healthcare, and Other priority occupations. Here are the minimum scores required for each category:

Date Number of
Invitations		 Stream Minimum
Score		 Description
July 11, 2023 35 Skilled Worker, International Graduate (includes EEBC option) 60 Targeted draw: Childcare: Early childhood educators and assistants (NOC 42202)
July 11, 2023 15 Skilled Worker, International Graduate (includes EEBC option) 60 Targeted draw: Healthcare
July 11, 2023 <5 Skilled Worker, International Graduate (includes EEBC option) 60 Targeted draw:
Other priority occupations (NOCs 31103, 32104)

margin_top=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_custom_heading text=”BC PNP Skills Immigration Categories” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1669814791596{margin-top: 30px !important;}”][vc_column_text]BC Provincial Nominee Program’s (BC PNP) Skills Immigration (SI) stream, a crucial pathway for skilled workers seeking provincial nomination in British Columbia. This stream encompasses various categories, offering exceptional opportunities for individuals with diverse backgrounds and expertise.

BC PNP Skilled Worker: The BC PNP Skilled Worker sub-category is tailored for individuals who have completed post-secondary education or training, gaining valuable work experience in a skilled occupation. Eligible candidates can seize the opportunity by securing a job offer from an employer located within the province of British Columbia. This sub-category opens doors to permanent residency for skilled professionals eager to contribute their talents to the vibrant BC workforce.

BC PNP Health Authority: Healthcare professionals hold a critical role in society, and the BC PNP Health Authority sub-category recognizes their value. Designed exclusively for doctors, nurses, psychiatric nurses, and allied health professionals, this category presents a remarkable pathway to the provincial nomination. Eligible candidates must secure a job offer in an eligible healthcare occupation within British Columbia, propelling them towards a fulfilling career and a new chapter in their lives.

BC PNP International Graduate: The BC PNP International Graduate sub-category caters to ambitious individuals who have recently graduated from a Canadian university or college. Armed with a fresh perspective and a desire for success, these graduates can secure a job offer from a BC employer in a skilled occupation aligned with their field of study. This category offers a promising avenue to establish a thriving career while building a future in beautiful British Columbia.

BC PNP International Post-Graduate: Elevating academia to new heights, the BC PNP International Post-Graduate sub-category welcomes Master’s and Doctoral degree graduates in natural, applied, or health sciences from eligible institutions in British Columbia. These accomplished individuals are recognized for their remarkable contributions to research and innovation. By offering a direct pathway to the provincial nomination, this category celebrates their academic achievements while fostering continued growth and success.

BC PNP Semi-Skilled: The BC PNP Semi-Skilled sub-category extends its reach to individuals seeking employment in the fields of tourism, hospitality, food processing, or long-haul trucking. Candidates with a valid job offer from a BC employer in an eligible occupation can explore this pathway, provided they meet specific language and employment requirements. This category opens doors to a prosperous future in thriving industries and offers a chance to contribute to BC’s vibrant economy.

https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/news/canada-targeted-express-entry-draw-for-french-speakers/[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

What is Express Entry BC Stream?

In a partnership between the Government of Canada’s Express Entry system and the province of British Columbia (BC), the Express Entry BC (EEBC) Stream brings forth an exceptional pathway to immigration. This collaborative effort allows BC to identify potential candidates from the Express Entry pool who may qualify for one of the EEBC streams.

By leveraging the power of the Express Entry system, the province of British Columbia aims to streamline the immigration process and identify candidates who possess the skills, qualifications, and experience to make significant contributions to the province’s economic growth and development. This strategic collaboration provides a unique opportunity for skilled professionals to pursue their Canadian dream in beautiful British Columbia.[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Need help?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1655824044795{padding-top: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]If you’re eager to kick-start your BC PNP journey, don’t hesitate to seek assistance from experienced immigration consultants at Team ELAAR. Led by Mr. Keshav Sharma, a Licensed Canadian Immigration Consultant.

excerpt.rendered: British Columbia announced the results of the BC PNP Latest Draw on July 11, 2023. In this draw, nearly 207 candidates were invited to apply under the BC PNP program.
